trans-unit.source: Get Indexer Status
trans-unit.target: Get Indexer Status

trans-unit.source: Get Indexer Status (Azure Search Service REST API)
trans-unit.target: Get Indexer Status (Azure Search Service REST API)

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Get Indexer Status</languageKeyword> operation retrieves the current status and execution history of an indexer:
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Get Indexer Status</languageKeyword> operation retrieves the current status and execution history of an indexer:

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>api-version</languageKeyword> is required.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>api-version</languageKeyword> is required.

trans-unit.source: The current version is <codeInline>2015-02-28</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The current version is <codeInline>2015-02-28</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service Versioning</link> has details, including more information about alternative versions.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service Versioning</link> has details, including more information about alternative versions.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>api-key</languageKeyword> must be an admin key (as opposed to a query key).
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>api-key</languageKeyword> must be an admin key (as opposed to a query key).

trans-unit.source: Refer to the authentication section in <link xlink:href="b298ac63-7b92-48cd-afe2-828538c47ca9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service REST API</link> to learn more about keys.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the authentication section in <link xlink:href="b298ac63-7b92-48cd-afe2-828538c47ca9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service REST API</link> to learn more about keys.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> explains how to get the service URL and key properties used in the request.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> explains how to get the service URL and key properties used in the request.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: Status Code: 200 OK for a successful response.
trans-unit.target: Status Code: 200 OK for a successful response.

trans-unit.source: The response body contains information about overall indexer health status, the last indexer invocation, as well as the history of recent indexer invocations (if present).
trans-unit.target: The response body contains information about overall indexer health status, the last indexer invocation, as well as the history of recent indexer invocations (if present).

trans-unit.source: A sample response body looks like this:
trans-unit.target: A sample response body looks like this:

trans-unit.source: Indexer status
trans-unit.target: Indexer status

trans-unit.source: Indexer status can be one of the following values:
trans-unit.target: Indexer status can be one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>running</languageKeyword> indicates that the indexer is running normally.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>running</languageKeyword> indicates that the indexer is running normally.

trans-unit.source: Note that some of the indexer executions may still be failing, so it's a good idea to check the <languageKeyword>lastResult</languageKeyword> property as well.
trans-unit.target: Note that some of the indexer executions may still be failing, so it's a good idea to check the <languageKeyword>lastResult</languageKeyword> property as well.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>error</languageKeyword> indicates that the indexer experienced an error that cannot be corrected without human intervention.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>error</languageKeyword> indicates that the indexer experienced an error that cannot be corrected without human intervention.

trans-unit.source: For example, the data source credentials may have expired, or the schema of the data source or of the target index has changed in a breaking way.
trans-unit.target: For example, the data source credentials may have expired, or the schema of the data source or of the target index has changed in a breaking way.

trans-unit.source: Indexer execution result
trans-unit.target: Indexer execution result

trans-unit.source: An indexer execution result contains information about a single indexer execution.
trans-unit.target: An indexer execution result contains information about a single indexer execution.

trans-unit.source: The latest result is surfaced as the <languageKeyword>lastResult</languageKeyword> property of the indexer status.
trans-unit.target: The latest result is surfaced as the <languageKeyword>lastResult</languageKeyword> property of the indexer status.

trans-unit.source: Other recent results, if present, are returned as the <languageKeyword>executionHistory</languageKeyword> property of the indexer status.
trans-unit.target: Other recent results, if present, are returned as the <languageKeyword>executionHistory</languageKeyword> property of the indexer status.

trans-unit.source: Indexer execution result contains the following properties:
trans-unit.target: Indexer execution result contains the following properties:

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>status</languageKeyword>: The status of an execution.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>status</languageKeyword>: The status of an execution.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="#bkmk_indexerstatus" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Indexer execution status</link> below for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="#bkmk_indexerstatus" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Indexer execution status</link> below for details.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>errorMessage</languageKeyword>: Error message for a failed execution.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>errorMessage</languageKeyword>: Error message for a failed execution.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>startTime</languageKeyword>: The time in UTC when this execution started.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>startTime</languageKeyword>: The time in UTC when this execution started.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>endTime</languageKeyword>: The time in UTC when this execution has ended.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>endTime</languageKeyword>: The time in UTC when this execution has ended.

trans-unit.source: This value is not set if the execution is still in progress.
trans-unit.target: This value is not set if the execution is still in progress.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>errors</languageKeyword>: A list of item-level errors, if any.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>errors</languageKeyword>: A list of item-level errors, if any.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>itemsProcessed</languageKeyword>: The number of data source items (for example, table rows) that the indexer attempted to index during this execution.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>itemsProcessed</languageKeyword>: The number of data source items (for example, table rows) that the indexer attempted to index during this execution.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>itemsFailed</languageKeyword>: The number of items that failed during this execution.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>itemsFailed</languageKeyword>: The number of items that failed during this execution.

trans-unit.source: The error provides the ID of the item that failed.
trans-unit.target: The error provides the ID of the item that failed.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>initialTrackingState</languageKeyword>: Always <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword> for the first indexer execution, or if the data change tracking policy is not enabled on the data source used.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>initialTrackingState</languageKeyword>: Always <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword> for the first indexer execution, or if the data change tracking policy is not enabled on the data source used.

trans-unit.source: If such a policy is enabled, in subsequent executions this value indicates the first (lowest) change tracking value processed by this execution.
trans-unit.target: If such a policy is enabled, in subsequent executions this value indicates the first (lowest) change tracking value processed by this execution.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>finalTrackingState</languageKeyword>: Always <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword> if the data change tracking policy is not enabled on the data source used.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>finalTrackingState</languageKeyword>: Always <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword> if the data change tracking policy is not enabled on the data source used.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, indicates the latest (highest) change tracking value successfully processed by this execution.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, indicates the latest (highest) change tracking value successfully processed by this execution.

trans-unit.source: Indexer execution status
trans-unit.target: Indexer execution status

trans-unit.source: Indexer execution status captures the status of a single indexer execution.
trans-unit.target: Indexer execution status captures the status of a single indexer execution.

trans-unit.source: It can have the following values:
trans-unit.target: It can have the following values:

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>success</languageKeyword> indicates that the indexer execution has completed successfully.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>success</languageKeyword> indicates that the indexer execution has completed successfully.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>inProgress</languageKeyword> indicates that the indexer execution is in progress.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>inProgress</languageKeyword> indicates that the indexer execution is in progress.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>transientFailure</languageKeyword> indicates that an indexer execution has failed.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>transientFailure</languageKeyword> indicates that an indexer execution has failed.

trans-unit.source: See <languageKeyword>errorMessage</languageKeyword> property for details.
trans-unit.target: See <languageKeyword>errorMessage</languageKeyword> property for details.

trans-unit.source: The failure may or may not require human intervention to fix it.
trans-unit.target: The failure may or may not require human intervention to fix it.

trans-unit.source: For example, fixing a schema incompatibility between the data source and the target index requires user action, while a temporary data source downtime does not.
trans-unit.target: For example, fixing a schema incompatibility between the data source and the target index requires user action, while a temporary data source downtime does not.

trans-unit.source: Indexer invocations will continue per schedule, if one is defined.
trans-unit.target: Indexer invocations will continue per schedule, if one is defined.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>persistentFailure</languageKeyword> indicates that the indexer has failed in a way that requires human intervention .
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>persistentFailure</languageKeyword> indicates that the indexer has failed in a way that requires human intervention .

trans-unit.source: Scheduled indexer executions stop.
trans-unit.target: Scheduled indexer executions stop.

trans-unit.source: After addressing the issue, use <link xlink:href="e36fa72a-a924-4e19-b7da-cd8f132c8963" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Reset Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)</link> to restart the scheduled executions.
trans-unit.target: After addressing the issue, use <link xlink:href="e36fa72a-a924-4e19-b7da-cd8f132c8963" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Reset Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)</link> to restart the scheduled executions.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Reset</languageKeyword> indicates that the indexer has been reset by a call to <link xlink:href="e36fa72a-a924-4e19-b7da-cd8f132c8963" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Reset Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Reset</languageKeyword> indicates that the indexer has been reset by a call to <link xlink:href="e36fa72a-a924-4e19-b7da-cd8f132c8963" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Reset Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.
